Key Arguments: The bill infringes on freedom of speech and expression.
The government should not be the sole arbiter of truth.
The guidelines for the bill are broad, ambiguous, and open to interpretation.
The government and mainstream media are exempt from the laws, which is unfair.
The bill could lead to government overreach and totalitarian control.
Existing platforms already have measures to combat misinformation.
The bill could lead to privacy invasions and misuse of personal data.
Notable Quotes: The right to freedom of opinion is the right to hold opinions without interference, and cannot be subject to any exception or restriction.

There is a real risk that efforts to combat online misinformation and disinformation by foreign actors could be used to legitimise attempts to restrict public debate, censor unpopular opinions and enforce ideological conformity in Australia.
This bill is a gross overreach of the Australian governmentâ€™s authority and overrides our right to Free Speech and our Human rights.
